bool GenerateBuiltInSymbolTable (  TInfoSink &  infoSink,
TSymbolTable *  symbolTables,
EShLanguage  language
) 
 

Generate the built in symbol table

Parameters:
infoSink Information sink (for errors/warnings)
symbolTables Array of symbol tables (one for each language)
bUseGlobalSymbolTable Whether to use the global symbol table or the per-language symbol table
language Shading language to build symbol table for
Returns:
True if succesfully built, false otherwise

ShHandle C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_ConstructParser (  const EShLanguage  language,
int  debugOptions
) 
 

Construct a parser for the given language (one per shader)

Parameters:
language The HLSL shader type of the input (EShLangVertex or EShLangFragment). This should be the type of the HLSL shader to translate.
debugOptions Debug options (see TDebugOptions)
Returns:
Handle to a new parser, or 0 on failure.

ShHandle C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_ConstructTranslator (  int  debugOptions  ) 
 

Construct a translator (one for each set of shaders to translate). Note that you can translate multiple vertex and fragment shaders together. The Hlsl2Glsl_Translate function will take in a list of parsed shaders and link them together to produce the final translated output.

Returns:
Handle to a new translator, or 0 on failure.

void C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_Destruct (  ShHandle  handle  ) 
 

Destroy a parser or translator

Parameters:
handle Handle to a parser or translator.

int C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_Finalize (   ) 
 

Finalize the HLSL2GLSL translator. This function should be called to de-initialize the HLSL2GLSL translator and should only be called once on shutdown.

Returns:
1 on success, 0 on failure

const char* C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_GetInfoLog (  const ShHandle  handle  ) 
 

After parsing or translating, retrieve the info log to get information.

Parameters:
handle Handle to a parser or translator
Returns:
As a string, the information log. 0 if the information is not available or the object is bad.

const char* C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_GetShader (  const ShHandle  handle,
EShLanguage  lang
) 
 

After translating HLSL shader(s), retrieve the translated GLSL source.

Parameters:
handle Handle to a translator, should be used only after calling Hlsl2Glsl_Translate
lang Language to get the shader source for (vertex of fragment)
Returns:
As a string, the translated GLSL source. NULL if the GLSL source is not available.

int C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_GetUniformCount (  const ShHandle  handle  ) 
 

After translating, retrieve the number of uniforms

Parameters:
handle Handle to a translator, should be used only after calling Hlsl2Glsl_Translate
Returns:
The number of uniforms in the translated shader.

const ShUniformInfo* C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_GetUniformInfo (  const ShHandle  handle  ) 
 

After translating, retrieve the uniform info table

Parameters:
handle Handle to a translator, should be used only after calling Hlsl2Glsl_Translate
Returns:
The table of uniforms in the translated shader. NULL if none.

int C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_Initialize (   ) 
 

Initialize the HLSL2GLSL translator. This function must be called once prior to calling any other HLSL2GLSL translator functions

Returns:
1 on success, 0 on failure

int C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_Parse (  const ShHandle  handle,
const char *const   shaderStrings[],
const int  numStrings,
int  debugOptions
) 
 

Parse HLSL shader(s) to prepare it for final translation. This function can take a string containing multiple HLSL shaders which will effectively be concatenated into a single shader to parse.

Parameters:
handle Handle to a valid parser (created with HLSL2GLSL_ConstructParser)
shaderStrings Array of HLSL shader source to parse
numStrings Number of HLSL shader strings in the shaderStrings array
debugOptions Debug options (see TDebugOptions)
Returns:
The return value of Hlsl2Glsl_Parse is 1 on success, 0 on failure The info-log should be written by Hlsl2Glsl_Parse into ShHandle, so it can answer future queries.

SH_IMPORT_EXPORT int C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_SetShaderHeader (  ShHandle  handle,
bool  bOutputShaderHeader,
const char *  shaderHeaderString
) 
 

Sets a string to output at the header of the GLSL output that the translator produces. This can be useful for example for generating OpenGL ES shaders where you want to prepend a string such as the following to the shader: ifdef GLES precision highp float; endif

Parameters:
handle Handle to the translator. This should be called BEFORE calling Hlsl2Glsl_Translate
bOutputShaderHeader If true, the string specified by "precisionString" will be output at the top of the GLSL output
shaderHeaderString The string to output at the top of the GLSL output
Returns:
1 on success, 0 on failure

int C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_SetUserAttributeNames (  ShHandle  handle,
const EAttribSemantic *  pSemanticEnums,
const char *  pSemanticNames[],
int  nNumSemantics
) 
 

Instead of mapping HLSL attributes to GLSL fixed-function attributes, this function can be used to override the attribute mapping. This tells the code generator to use user-defined attributes for the semantics that are specified.

Parameters:
handle Handle to the translator. This should be called BEFORE calling Hlsl2Glsl_Translate
pSemanticEnums Array of semantic enums to set
pSemanticNames Array of user attribute names to use
nNumSemantics Number of semantics to set in the arrays
Returns:
1 on success, 0 on failure

int C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_Translate (  const ShHandle  translatorHandle,
const ShHandle  parserHandles[],
const int  numHandles,
const char *  vertexEntry,
const char *  fragmentEntry
) 
 

After parsing one or more HLSL shaders, do the final translation to GLSL. This function also has the ability to link together multiple HLSL parsed shaders. So, for example, you can use this function to generate both a translated vertex and fragment shader.

Parameters:
translatorHandle Handle to a valid translator (created with HLSL2GLSL_ConstructTranslator)
parserHandles Array of parsed HLSL shaders (see Hlsl2Glsl_Parse)
numHandles Number of HLSL parsed shaders in the parserHandles[] array
vertexEntry The string name of the vertex shader main entry point (e.g. "main", "VS"). NULL if none.
fragmentEntry The string name of the fragment shader main entry point (e.g. "main", "PS"). NULL if none.
Returns:
The return value of Hlsl2Glsl_Translate is 1 on success, 0 on failure The info-log should be written by Hlsl2Glsl_Translate into ShHandle, so it can answer future queries.

int C_DECL Hlsl2Glsl_UseUserVaryings (  ShHandle  handle,
bool  bUseUserVaryings
) 
 

Instead of using OpenGL fixed-function varyings (such as gl_TexCoord[x]), use user named varyings instead.

Parameters:
handle Handle to the translator. This should be called BEFORE calling Hlsl2Glsl_Translate
bUseUserVarying If true, all user varyings will be used. If false, the translator will attempt to use GL fixed-function varyings
Returns:
1 on success, 0 on failure

bool InitializeSymbolTable (  TBuiltInStrings *  BuiltInStrings,
EShLanguage  language,
TInfoSink &  infoSink,
TSymbolTable *  symbolTables,
bool  bUseGlobalSymbolTable
) 
 

Initializize the symbol table

Parameters:
BuiltInStrings Pointer to built in strings.
language Shading language to initialize symbol table for
infoSink Information sink (for errors/warnings)
symbolTables Array of symbol tables (one for each language)
bUseGlobalSymbolTable Whether to use the global symbol table or the per-language symbol table
Returns:
True if succesfully initialized, false otherwise
